intro: Monelasmum djallonense, commonly known as the Djallonense mallow, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces showy, pale pink to white flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
